summary.para: Combines this geometry with the specified geometry and stores the result in an .

param.name: inputGeometry
param.para: The geometry to combine with this instance.

param.name: combineMode
param.para: The type of combine operation to perform.

param.name: inputGeometryTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to inputGeometry before combining, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: The result of the combine operation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Describes the intersection between this geometry and the specified geometry. The comparison is performed using the default flattening tolerance.

param.name: inputGeometryTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to inputGeometry, or NULL.

param.name: relation
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a value that describes how this geometry is related to inputGeometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: When interpreting the returned relation value, it is important to remember that the member of the D2D1_GEOMETRY_RELATION enumeration type means that this geometry is contained inside inputGeometry, not that this geometry contains inputGeometry.
For more information about how to interpret other possible return values, see .

param.name: relation

summary.para: Computes the area of the geometry after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the specified tolerance.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry before computing its area, or NULL.

param.name: area
param.para: When this this method returns, contains a pointer to the area of the transformed, flattened version of this geometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Computes the area of the geometry after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the specified tolerance.

param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry before computing its area, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: area
param.para: When this this method returns, contains a pointer to the area of the transformed, flattened version of this geometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.para: The transform to be applied to this geometry before computing its area.

param.name: area

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calculates the length of the geometry as though each segment were unrolled into a line.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating its length, or NULL.

param.name: length
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the length of the geometry. For closed geometries, the length includes an implicit closing segment. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calculates the length of the geometry as though each segment were unrolled into a line.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating its length, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: length
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the length of the geometry. For closed geometries, the length includes an implicit closing segment. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calculates the length of the geometry as though each segment were unrolled into a line.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calculates the point and tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the default tolerance.

param.name: length
param.para: The distance along the geometry of the point and tangent to find. If this distance is less than 0, this method calculates the first point in the geometry. If this distance is greater than the length of the geometry, this method calculates the last point in the geometry.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating the specified point and tangent, or NULL.

param.name: point
param.para: The location at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this point contains NaN as its x and y values.

param.name: unitTangentVector
param.para: The tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this vector contains NaN as its x and y values.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Calculates the point and tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the specified tolerance.

param.name: length
param.para: The distance along the geometry of the point and tangent to find. If this distance is less than 0, this method calculates the first point in the geometry. If this distance is greater than the length of the geometry, this method calculates the last point in the geometry.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating the specified point and tangent, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: point
param.para: The location at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this point contains NaN as its x and y values.

param.name: unitTangentVector
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this vector contains NaN as its x and y values. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Indicates whether the area filled by this geometry would contain the specified point.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry prior to testing for containment, or NULL.

param.name: contains
param.para: When this method returns, contains a BOOL value that is TRUE if the area filled by the geometry contains point; otherwise, FALSE. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Indicates whether the area filled by the geometry would contain the specified point given the specified flattening tolerance.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry prior to testing for containment, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The numeric accuracy with which the precise geometric path and path intersection is calculated. Points missing the fill by less than the tolerance are still considered inside. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: contains
param.para: When this method returns, contains a BOOL value that is TRUE if the area filled by the geometry contains point; otherwise, FALSE. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Indicates whether the area filled by the geometry would contain the specified point.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry prior to testing for containment.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves the bounds of the geometry.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry before calculating its bounds, or NULL.

param.name: bounds
param.para: When this method returns, contains the bounds of this geometry. If the bounds are empty, this parameter will be a rect where bounds.left > bounds.right. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves the bounds of the geometry.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry before calculating its bounds.

param.name: bounds
param.para: When this method returns, contains the bounds of this geometry. If the bounds are empty, this parameter will be a rect where bounds.left > bounds.right. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the bounds of the geometry after it has been widened by the specified stroke width and style and transformed by the specified matrix.

param.name: strokeWidth
param.para: The amount by which to widen the geometry by stroking its outline.

param.name: strokeStyle
param.para: The style of the stroke that widens the geometry.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: A transform to apply to the geometry after the geometry is transformed and after the geometry has been stroked, or NULL.

param.name: bounds
param.para: When this method returns, contains the bounds of the widened geometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the bounds of the geometry after it has been widened by the specified stroke width and style and transformed by the specified matrix.

summary.para: Computes the outline of the geometry and writes the result to an .

param.name: flatteningTolerance

param.para: The to which the geometry transformed outline is appended.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT

summary.para: Creates a simplified version of the geometry that contains only lines and (optionally) cubic Bezier curves and writes the result to an .

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: The to which the simplified geometry is appended.

summary.para: Determines whether the geometry's stroke contains the specified point given the specified stroke thickness, style, and transform.

param.name: point
param.para: The point to test for containment.

param.name: strokeWidth
param.para: The thickness of the stroke to apply.

param.name: strokeStyle
param.para: The style of stroke to apply.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the stroked geometry.

param.name: contains
param.para: When this method returns, contains a boolean value set to true if the geometry's stroke contains the specified point; otherwise, false. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Creates a set of clockwise-wound triangles that cover the geometry after it has been transformed using the specified matrix and flattened using the default tolerance.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to this geometry.

param.name: tessellationSink
param.para: The to which the tessellated is appended.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Widens the geometry by the specified stroke and writes the result to an after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the specified tolerance.

param.name: strokeWidth
param.para: The amount by which to widen the geometry.

param.name: strokeStyle
param.para: The style of stroke to apply to the geometry, or NULL.

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry after widening it, or NULL.

param.name: flatteningTolerance
param.para: The maximum error allowed when constructing a polygonal approximation of the geometry. No point in the polygonal representation will diverge from the original geometry by more than the flattening tolerance. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: The to which the widened geometry is appended.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: strokeWidth

param.name: strokeStyle

param.name: worldTransform
param.para: The transform to apply to the geometry after widening it.

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: The to which the widened geometry is appended.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: flatteningTolerance

param.name: geometrySink
param.para: The to which the widened geometry is appended.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: strokeWidth

param.name: strokeStyle

summary.para: Represents a geometry resource and defines a set of helper methods for manipulating and measuring geometric shapes. Interfaces that inherit from ID2D1Geometry define specific shapes.

remarks.para: There are several types of Direct2D geometry objects: a simple geometry (, , or ), a path geometry (), or a composite geometry ( and ).
Direct2D geometries enable you to describe two-dimensional figures and also offer many uses, such as defining hit-test regions, clip regions, and even animation paths.

Direct2D geometries are immutable and device-independent resources created by . In general, you should create geometries once and retain them for the life of the application, or until they need to be modified. For more information about device-independent and device-dependent resources, see the Resources Overview.
